source: 211 Maine, Maine Bureau of Veterans' Services, Maine Department of Veterans Affairs

resources.name: Maine Bureau of Veterans' Services - Central Office
resources.description: State agency providing comprehensive support and resources for Maine's veterans including disability benefits, education, housing, employment, and memorial services

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: 24/7 free confidential crisis support for veterans and families experiencing mental health crises, PTSD, suicidal thoughts

resources.name: 211 Maine
resources.description: Free, confidential information and referral service connecting veterans to local resources for housing, food, health, employment, legal aid, and other community services. Available 24/7 in all languages.

resources.name: Maine Veterans' Memorial Cemetery System
resources.description: State cemetery operations providing burial coordination, headstones, and military funeral honors for Maine veterans

resources.name: MaineHousing Veterans Housing Program
resources.description: Provides affordable housing options and assistance to homeless and at-risk veterans, including rental assistance and supportive services

resources.name: Maine Veterans' Emergency Financial Assistance Program (VEFAP)
resources.description: Helps eligible veterans cover essential expenses such as rent or mortgage payments, utilities, vehicle repairs, and other urgent needs to prevent financial instability

resources.name: Maine Department of Labor Veterans' Employment Services
resources.description: Offers employment assistance and resources to veterans seeking civilian employment including job placement, training programs, and resume assistance

resources.name: Maine Homeless Veterans Coordination Team
resources.description: Coordinates efforts to reduce homeless veterans through transitional housing programs and partnerships with community agencies

resources.name: Hire Heroes USA
resources.description: Employment assistance and job placement services for veterans overcoming employment barriers

resources.name: Wounded Warrior Project
resources.description: Support and services for post-9/11 veterans and service members with physical or mental injuries

resources.name: U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs
resources.description: Nationwide services and resources for veterans and families including healthcare, benefits, homeless services, and women veterans programs

resources.name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
resources.description: 24/7 free and confidential support for people in distress with crisis support and prevention resources

additional_resources.homeless_veteran_hotline: 1-877-424-3838 - National Call Center for Homeless Veterans

notes: This directory includes major state and federal veteran resources in Maine. For county-specific services and local Veterans Service Officers, contact the Maine Bureau of Veterans' Services at 207-287-7020. Many services are free and confidential.
